comments.author: laughedelic
comments.body: Why not to do the same then in `docs/building/osx.md` and the links to it?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
From Wikipedia:

> Major revision 10, from 2001 to present, was originally branded "Mac OS X", renamed to "OS X" in 2012,[4] and announced to be renamed to "macOS" in the upcoming version in 2016.

We've gone with OS X as that was the correct name last year. If Apple has now officially rebranded to macOS, we should update the usage everywhere throughout the documentation.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
We also have the variable `$IsOSX` and the api `[System.Management.Automation.Platform]::IsOSX` to consider.

Of course, once we land on the right api, we'll need to stick with it for compat, we don't want two apis just because marketing changed their minds.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @lzybkr that's an excellent point, but I would recommend sticking with `OSX` in code to be consistent with [.NET Core's established convention](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/src/System.Runtime.InteropServices.RuntimeInformation/ref/System.Runtime.InteropServices.RuntimeInformation.cs#L15) (which is all that `$IsOSX` maps to).

comments.author: z11h
comments.body: @andschwa I agree. The `OSX` naming scheme would have to be a change in the `.Net Core` project. For now, I don't think there is anything we can do about that 😄
